module.title: tric
module.p: tric is a adjective meaning frequent.
gu tric is a frequency adverbial meaning often –

lix.gd: Gu tric air an oidhche bhiodh e a’ cluinntinn guth athar ag èigheachd, “Blainne blàth na Fìrinn,” oir ’s e ministear a bha na athair cuideachd nuair a bha e beò.
lix.tr: Often at night he would hear his father’s voice shouting “the warm milk of Truth”, because his father that been a minister too when he was alive.

lix.gd: Ma bha Hegel a’ déiligeadh ris an t-saoghal ar an taobh a-muigh, ’sann a bha Kierkegaard a’ déiligeadh gu tric ris an fheallsanach fhéin.
lix.tr: If Hegel dealt with the outside world, it was the philosopher himself that K. usually dealt with.

module.p: Note also glè thric very often –

li.gd: Mar a thachras glè thric, thàinig an ceàrrachas gu bhith na bheò-ghlacadh a bha a’ slugadh a h-uile sgillinn a bha iad a’ cosnadh ag obair air talamh, arbhar is mòine.
li.tr: As happens very often, gambling came to be an addiction that swallowed every penny they earned working on the land, corn and peat

module.p: The gu is sometimes dropped, especially in informal usage –

li.gd: Fiù nach robh an aon tatù air a ghàirdean agus bhiodh e tric an Glaschu a’ cèilidh air a bhràthair agus a’ cleachdadh Fiat a bhràthar.
li.tr: Even if he had not had the same tattoo on his arm and he would often be in Glasgow visiting his brother and using his brother’s Fiat.

module.p: mar as trice is a frequency adverbial meaning usually –

li.gd: Mar as tric’ ’s e aon ghlaim a bheir siorc à duine.
li.tr: Usually a shark will just get one bite of a man.

li.gd: Bhiodh e na shuidhe mar bu trice anns a’ mhansa a’ deasachadh a shearmoin airson na Sàbaid, agus cha robh e a’ tighinn a-steach air gu robh an taigh dorch, gruamach.
li.tr: He would usually be sitting in the manse going over his sermon for the Sabbath, and it didn’t occur to him that the house was dark and gloomy.

module.p: is tric a is a frequency construction meaning often –

li.gd: ’S tric a bhios daoine a’ bruidhinn air na rudan èibhinn no eirmseach a thuirt e, ged tha fios gun deach iomadh facal a chur na bheul nach tuirt e idir.
li.tr: People often talk about the funny or witty things he said, although we know that many words have been put in his mouth which he never said.

li.gd: Ach tha fios a’m a-nise gur tric a tha an dìoghaltas a’ cosg barrachd air na ’s fhiach e.
li.tr: But I know now that revenge often costs more than it is worth.
